column4: Can anyone think of a reason why an ubuntu box would all of a sudden start refusing ssh and http requests?  I just went up to it and rebooted it, and it was ok.  An hour later (once I'm back home a half hour away of course) it's refusing conections again)
I went through the logs and so no evidence of hacking
could have lost net connection....is it behind a router?
It's behind a sonicwall, buti t was working fine until this weekend
if it suddenly started refusing connections it sounds like an IP address changed somewhere, either internally or your WAN ip changed
no.  They're all windows boxes and I haven't forwarded any vnc ports or anything to them
nope; static ip
you can login via ssh from windows, just use putty
right, but I can't get to a windows box on that network
which IP address is static?
Theirs, the one with the ubuntu box I'm trying to get into
i mean is the internal IP address static or is the WAN ip static or are they both?
the public and ubuntu ip are both static.
did you get my PM?
yeah
i get 100% packet loss when pinging that IP
could be the firewall is dropping them.  I can log into the firewall, so the ip is up
you sure the ubuntu machine is up then?
but ssh got you nothing?
connection refused.  port forwarded to 22, right?
yep.  Ok, it's not jsut me then
having kids is very difficult when one wants to really swear at a box...
indeed, but i wouldn't know...hehe  well, if it just stopped working chances are the machine locked up
maybe he should use nano if he's just editing plain text?  fewer weird commands to have to worry about for just text editing.
